newsitem.title: USA: World Bank should lend more - India finance minister.
newsitem.headline: World Bank should lend more - India finance minister.

text.p: The World Bank could double the amount it lends to developing countries, especially on social development programmes, Indian Finance Minister Palaniappan Chidambaram said on Wednesday.
"We would have liked a little more discussion on World Bank lending," he told reporters during the annual meeting of the International Monetary Fund and World Bank.
Current World Bank lending of $15 billion a year is the same as it was a decade ago, he noted, and argued that there is room to increase it to $30 billion.
He also wanted the Bank act as a guarantor of loans.

Commenting on the relief agreed at this meeting for the world's heavily indebted poor countries, Chidambaram said it was important to realise that the money the World Bank was putting in could also have been used elsewhere.
"We hope this will be a one-time initiative."
The situation should not be allowed to happen again nor the impression given that the Bank would always bail out those countries which had got into trouble through unsound economic policies.

Financial sources have said that India, itself a heavy borrower and largest user of the World Bank's concessional lending, had been reluctant to let other developing country borrowers off the hook when it had always met its own debt repayments.
